messages.title: A STRONG VOICE FOR THE PEOPLE OF ARFON
messages.content: "If you elect me as your MP I will be a good advocate for you and for Arfon," says Robin Millar.

messages.title: BUILDING A FUTURE FOR ARFON
messages.content: Robin is focused on celebrating and sharing local successes, highlighting the annual 'Dinas Dys' and 'the Refresher Fair', encouraging students to stay local, and supporting tourism.

messages.title: CHANGE IS COMING HOME!
messages.content: Robin talks about the backdrop of economic and social challenges in Llandudno, advocating for new opportunities and improvements in housing and jobs.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: When Gwynedd Council proposed closing Uniterb, Robin staged a successful action to keep the college open and protect education funding.
Robin wants to get Arfon working again, with a focus on supporting education and public sector jobs, and revitalizing the local economy.

issues.economy: "Arfon's beauty cannot hide its economic and social challenges," Robin told the Conservative Party Conference in Llandudno.
issues.education: Highlights the importance of education and the action taken to keep Coleg Menai open.

housing.content: Emphasizes the need for improvements in housing as part of addressing broader social and economic challenges.

leaflet.personalStatement: Robin takes the concerns of parents right to the top!

quotes.text: Robin takes the concerns of parents right to the top!
"Robins just like his dad!" says Sheila Jenkins who has supported Vyne Robert's MP campaign and will work hard for us.

images.caption: Robin interacts with various groups and individuals, emphasizing his connection with the community.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet focuses on local issues, personal commitment to the constituency, and Robin Millar's advocacy for education and economic development. Specific policy details are not mentioned.
